paragraphs.text: Another climate change summit: Don't give up.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Many have simply lost faith in global climate negotiations summits such as COP 20 starting in Lima, Peru today
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: while
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the process has not delivered the climate action we need
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I would argue that this year key things have changed
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that we must continue to demand from our politicians that they listen and act and, by that, safeguard the future of next and current generations on this planet
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As nations start the latest global round of climate change negotiations in Lima, Peru today
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: it is easy to be cynical
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Because in the 20 plus years that our governments have been meeting for global climate meetings, emissions have risen more than ever before
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This year is already predicted to be the warmest since records began
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And yet
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: this is a moment of opportunity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Because things are changing, really changing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the climate movement, in the economy and in the politics of climate change
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Today, the climate movement all over the world is reenergised
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The largest ever climate march in New York this September was a powerful symbol for the global rise of a movement that is stopping pipelines and coal plants as well as forcing renewable energy solutions all over the world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In economics, too, we live in a different world
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Cost-effective, sensible renewable energy solutions have made quantum leaps
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Renewables are the most economical solution for new power capacity in an ever-increasing number of countries
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: One hundred percent of new power capacity added in the United States in August was renewable
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: countries such as Denmark and Germany are producing new "clean electricity" records almost every month
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: China is installing as much solar this year as the US has ever done
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Bilateral agreement
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: The recent bilateral agreement between China and the United States to cut pollution and drive cleaner energy sources is, in addition, a sign of changing politics
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Many said that such an agreement was impossible, that it would not happen in our lifetimes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And yet it did
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Only a fool would argue that the action proposed by these two biggest polluters and biggest economies is enough
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is not enough, experts have already told us, to protect our planet from a potential three or four degree Celsius rise in global temperatures - with all the disastrous consequences that would have for us, our children, and our ecosystems
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But the fact that the world's biggest emitters have come together moves us from a"you go first" mentality, that had paralysed global climate negotiations for years, to an"I will act if you will act" frame
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At Lima, others must now follow
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: our pressure must speed up the action
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Because we need an agreement to tackle the climate crisis
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which meets the needs of the many not the few
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Because it is ordinary people living in flood and drought prone areas, dependent for their livelihoods on fishing, farming and forests, or living in cities engulfed by pollution or in housing that cannot protect them from storms or heat waves, who are bearing the brunt of our experiment with the world's climate
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The United Nations - where every country has a voice, not matter how small, relatively poor or vulnerable- are still the only place where we can hope to secure action that takes full account of these peoples' rights
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: At Lima, we need governments to make sure that the direction is right
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They need to agree a goal of ending carbon pollution and deliver renewable energy for all people on this planet by 2050
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And in Lima, governments must agree to renew and review their targets every five years, starting in 2025
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Not just to cut pollution, but to help the vulnerable adapt to climate change, and to support poorer countries to provide sustainable energy access for their populations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Every government should already be preparing their "intended nationally determined contribution" - their offer towards the Paris deal
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Before March 2015 we must see concrete, ambitious plans from each and every one of the world's polluting nations - to phase out coal and nuclear power, to install solar and wind energy, to increase energy efficiency, to build cleaner and more livable cities, and to protect forests
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In Lima, governments must agree to review whether these plans are enough to prevent climate chaos and whether the effort is shared fairly between richer and poorer nations before they meet again in Paris in December 2015
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In Lima, we expect scientists, business people and investors, city mayors, faith leaders and civil society organisations from all over the world to be calling for more ambitious climate action
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The climate movement gets broader and more effective day
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is an unstoppable force now
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: in Lima and Paris, we will make our voices heard
paragraphs.label: assumption
